item.title: Apple is challenging U.K.’s iCloud encryption backdoor order
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Apple is challenging a U.K. Government data access order in the Investigatory Powers Tribunal (IPT), the Financial Times reports. The order targeted iCloud backups that are protected by end-to-end encryption. Last month, press leaks revealed the existence of the January order asking Apple to build a backdoor in iCloud’s encrypted backups. U.K. officials are exercising […]

item.title: Darwinbox, the HR upstart from India, raises $140M to take on Deel and Rippling
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Darwinbox, an Indian startup building a SaaS platform for hiring, onboarding and employee administration, has raised $140 million to take on the likes of Rippling and Deel as it seeks to expand internationally, especially in the U.S. The funding is being co-led by KKR and Partners Group, and is a mix of primary and secondary […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: From high school science project to $18.3M: AI-accelerated enzymes are coming for fast fashion’s plastic waste
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
A U.K. startup, originating from founder Jacob Nathan’s high school science project on using enzymes to break down plastic waste, has secured an oversubscribed $18.3 million in Series A funding. Founded in 2019 in London, Epoch Biodesign now a 30+ strong multidisciplinary team of chemists, biologists and software engineers. It will be using the new […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: CoreWeave acquires AI developer platform Weights & Biases
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Nvidia-backed data center company CoreWeave has acquired AI developer platform Weights & Biases for an undisclosed sum. According to The Information, CoreWeave spent $1.7 billion on the transaction. Weights & Biases was valued at $1.25 billion in 2023, and it recently filed for an IPO. Lukas Biewald, Chris Van Pelt, and Shawn Lewis founded Weights & Biases […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: CoreWeave partner EcoDataCenter racks up half a billion dollars to build more sustainable buildings for AI
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
EcoDataCenter, a Swedish company that builds eco-friendly data centers used by major compute providers to handle their AI traffic, has raised nearly half a billion dollars — $478 million (€450 million) to be exact — in anticipation of more demand.  The equity funding, which is coming from a group of unnamed institutional investors, will be […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta brings its anti-scam facial recognition test to the UK
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Last October, Meta dipped its toe into the world of facial recognition with an international test of two new tools: one to stop scams based on likenesses of famous people, and a second feature to help people get back into compromised Facebook or Instagram accounts. Now, that test is expanding to one more notable country. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Defense tech startup Epirus raises $250M Series D to counter drone swarms
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Defense tech startup Epirus has raised a $250m Series D to expand its counter-drone solutions.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Quantexa nabs $175M at $2.6B valuation to double down on data analytics for AI
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
British startup Quantexa has made a name for itself over the years with its enterprise platform that employs AI and data analytics to fight money laundering and fraud. Today, the company said it has raised a fresh $175 million to double down on that business and move deeper into another hot area: helping organizations understand […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Key ex-OpenAI researcher subpoenaed in AI copyright case
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Alec Radford, a researcher who helped develop many of OpenAI’s key AI technologies, has been subpoenaed in a copyright case against the AI startup, according to a court filing Tuesday. The filing, submitted by an attorney for the plaintiffs to the U.S. District Court in the Northern District of California, indicated that Radford was served […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Judge rejects Musk’s attempt to block OpenAI’s for-profit transition
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
A federal judge in Northern California denied Elon Musk’s motion for an injunction that would have halted OpenAI’s planned transition into a for-profit company, Bloomberg reported. Musk failed to provide enough evidence necessary for an injunction, U.S. District Court Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers ruled Tuesday. However, Rogers said the court is prepared to hold an […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aspiration co-founder and board member defrauded investors of $145M, prosecutors say
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The fintech startup has been under federal scrutiny for years for questionable financial and carbon accounting practices.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Amazon reportedly forms a new agentic AI group
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Amazon has formed a new group within AWS dedicated to creating AI agents, systems that help people automate parts of their lives, Reuters reported on Tuesday. In an email to staff seen by Reuters, AWS CEO Matt Garman said agentic AI has the potential to be “the next multi-billion business for AWS.” A longtime AWS […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: X updates Communities with new filters, sorting options, and a way to see your own posts
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
X is bringing more attention to Communities, a feature that allows X users to connect and engage in discussions around a given topic, similar to how it’s done on Reddit. Today, tabs to access popular Communities are pinned to the top of the app’s homepage alongside your For You feed and other Lists. Now, you’ll […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: African VC LoftyInc Capital launches third fund for seed and Series A, reaches $43M first close
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
One of Africa’s most active investors, known for early bets on unicorns like Flutterwave, Andela, and Wave, has secured fresh capital to invest in startups across the continent. This comes as funding deals and volumes in Africa saw only a slight dip last year, according to a report by VC firm Partech. LoftyInc Capital, which […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Andy Dunn’s new app Pie uses AI to help you make friends
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
“We’re a long way from pants,” Andy Dunn, founder of online fashion retailer Bonobos, told TechCrunch. Now, the former CEO is taking on a completely different challenge: He wants to help people make friends. Dunn’s newest venture, Pie, is a social app focused on bringing people together in real life. With an $11.5 million Series […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Foundation Capital, an early backer of Solana and Cerebras, raises $600M fund
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Foundation Capital has come a long way since it was forced to scale down its fund size from $750 million in 2008 to $282 million (its sixth main fund) in 2013. On Tuesday, the 30-year-old firm announced that it raised a $600 million eleventh flagship fund, which is 20% larger than the predecessor $500 million […]

item.title: Klarna CEO doubts that other companies will replace Salesforce with AI
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
The founder and CEO of IPO-bound fintech Klarna took to X to once again explain why his company ditched Salesforce’s flagship CRM product about a year ago in favor of its own homegrown AI system.  But this time, Sebastian Siemiatkowski emphasized that he doesn’t think others will — or should — follow his lead. “I […]

item.title: Amazon is reportedly developing its own AI ‘reasoning’ model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Amazon reportedly wants to get in on the AI “reasoning” model game. According to Business Insider, Amazon is developing an AI model that incorporates advanced “reasoning” capabilities, similar to models like OpenAI’s o3-mini and Chinese AI lab DeepSeek’s R1. The model may launch as soon as June under Amazon’s Nova brand, which the company introduced […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google still limits how Gemini answers political questions
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
While several of Google’s rivals, including OpenAI, have tweaked their AI chatbots to discuss politically sensitive subjects in recent months, Google appears to be embracing a more conservative approach. When asked to answer certain political questions, Google’s AI-powered chatbot, Gemini, often says it “can’t help with responses on elections and political figures right now,” TechCrunch’s […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Hackers launder most of Bybit’s stolen crypto worth $1.4B
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Experts note that this is just the first step for the alleged North Korean hackers to profit from the historic heist.
